title.rendered: Sleep: Strategies to support sleep for children with sensory disability

content.rendered:
NextSense Institute

Sleep problems in young deaf children is a frequent topic in the Aussie Deaf Kids online groups. It can be difficult to know whether the issue is a ‘deaf thing’ or a ‘child thing’.

NextSense Institute has the recording of a webinar on sleep which is available to watch whenever it suits you! The webinar costs $10 for parents.

Title: Sleep: strategies to support sleep for children with sensory disability

Sleep is vitally important for children and their parents. Karen Willcocks shares evidence based practical tips to help children with sensory disability get more sleep. She also shares practical tips for parents with young children experiencing sleep challenges.

This session provides advice and suggestions for both parents and professionals supporting families.

About the Presenter: Karen Willcocks is a Child and Family Health Nurse educator who has been working for Karitane, developing sleep programs with and for parents for almost 20 years.

Register to watch the webinar here.
